The dictionary is available for online browsing through the CLARIN Knowledge Centre for Belarusian text and speech processing.

Name: Lithuanian-Latvian Dictionary
Description: This is a bilingual dictionary that is available for online browsing.

Name: Rendering Dictionary of Personal Names
Description: This dictionary contains person names in four languages (Czech, French, Italian and German) and their renderings in Latvian in accordance with the rendering rules of proper nouns. The resource is available for online browsing.

Name: The Dictionary of Estonian Phraseology
Description: This is a dictionary that contains phrasemes from various stylistic registers. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: English-Greek Dictionary of False Friends
Description: This is a dictionary of false friends available for download from clarin:el.

Name: Slovenian-German Dictionary of Maks Pleteršnik (1894-1895)
Description: This is a historical dictionary compiling the works of Maks Pleteršnik. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI and for online browsing.

Name: The Advisory Dictionary of Document Language
Description: This is a dictionary for simple, plain and precise expression in official communication. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: Dalin's Dictionary (2017-10-16)
Description: Dalin's Dictionary of 19th century Swedish. The resource can be download from the SWE-CLARIN repository and can be queried online through KARP.

Name: Low-German Loanwords in the Estonian Language
Description: This is a dictionary of Low-German loanwords. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: First Estonian Slang Dictionary
Description: This is a dictionary of Estonian slang that is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: iWNT
Description: The dictionary describes the meaning and history of hundred thousands of words in written Dutch, from the period 1500-1976. The resource is available for online browsing through the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: North Saami-Finnish dictionary
Description: This is a bilingual dictionary that is available for download from CLARINO.

Name: Livonian-Estonian-Latvian Dictionary
Description: This is a trilingual dictionary that is available for online browsing.

Name: Mühlenbach­ Endzelin Latvian Dictionary (MEV)
Description: This is a bilingual dictionary that is available for online browsing.

Name: Words of the 16th-Century Slovenian Literary Language
Description: This is a historical dictionary that provides comprehensive information on the vocabulary used in the Slovenian literary language during the period of the Reformation. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI and for online browsing.

Name: Comprehensive Estonian-French Dictionary
Description: This is a bilingual dictionary that is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: Dictionaries of the CLARIN-PL Lexical Platform
Description:
This is a collection of the following 4 dictionaries, which are available through the same online environment:
  1. Grammatical Dictionary of Polish (334,845 entries)
  2. Vilnius Dictionary (108,513 entries)
  3. The Polish Electronic Dictionary of the 16th c. (30,700 entries)
  4. The Polish Electronic Dictionary of the 17th and 18th c. (38,915 entries)
All the 4 dictionaries are available through the same online lexical platform developed by CLARIN-PL.
Licence: Other - Institute of Computer Science PAS

Name: Dictionary of Old Dutch (ONW)
Description: This is a historical dictionary of Old Dutch vocabulary from the period from the period between 500 and 1200. The resource is available for online browsing through the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: Karelian Dictionary
Description: This is a monolingual dictionary that is available for download and for online browsing through the Language Bank of Finland.

Name: A digital dictionary of Dagaare
Description: This dictionary, which illustrates salient aspects of the Dagaare lexico-grammatical system, is available for download from ARCHE.

Name: The Dictionary of Estonian Dialects (2013-...)
Description: This is a dialectal dictionary with phonetic and grammatical information, information on the area of distribution, and meaning of dialectal words. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: Online Lexicon of Veps Language
Description: This is a dictionary of the Veps Language available for online browsing through FIN-CLARIN.

Name: Digital Dictionary of the German Language (DWDS)
Description:
This collection consists of the following digitized dictionaries:
  1. Dictionary of contemporary German
  2. DWDS-Dictionary
  3. Etymological dictionary of German
  4. The German Dictionary by Jacob Grimm and Wilhelm Grimm
  5. The Great Dictionary of the German Language in 10 Volumes
  6. OpenThesaurus
This collection is available for online browsing from a dedicated environment associated with CLARIN-D.

Name: Dictionary of Slovenian Particles
Description: This is a dictionary of connectives, disjuncts, emphasisers; not to be confused with English adverbial particles despite its name. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI and for online browsing.

Name: Woordenboek van Nieuwe Woorden (WNW)
Description:
The Dictionary of New Words (WNW) is an online dictionary describing words that came into existence from the year 2000 onwards.
The WNW includes not only new words that are here to stay (app, selfie, keuzestress, ontspullen), but also many new words that have been around for a shorter time.
The resource is available for online browsing through the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: The Dictionary of Old Võru Dialect
Description: This dictionary is on the archaic Võru dialect spoken in the second half of the 19th and in the first half of the 20th century. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: Anglų kalbos žodynas
Description: This is a bilingual dictionary available for online browsing.

Name: The Dictionary of Estonian Synonyms
Description: This is a comprehensive dictionary of Estonian synonyms. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: French-Greek lexicon of idioms
Description: This is a glossary of idioms that supplies their wider contextual information (the context, the level of language, the connotation, the feeling that it transfers). The resource is available for download from clarin:el.

Name: Dictionary of Contemporary Latvian Language (MLVV)
Description:
This is a dictionary that contains examples of the standard Latvian language.
The dictionary is available for online browsing and for download from the CLARIN-LV repository.

Name: The Online Dictionary of Estonian Sign Language - Estonian
Description:
The dictionary contains over 4,000 entry words, enabling search either by an Estonian word or a by a sign of Estonian sign language.
The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: A digital dictionary of Damascus Arabic
Description: This small-sized dictionary of Spoken Damascus Arabic has mainly been compiled for comparative and didactic purposes, and comprises all words in Prochazka's 2-volume textbook Lehrbuch des Syrisch-Arabischen. The resource is available for download from ARCHE.

Name: The Livonian-German Dictionary
Description: This bilingual dictionary is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: Historical Dictionary of Latvian (16th-17th Centuries) (LVVV)
Description: This is a dictionary of Latvian from the period between the 16th and 17th centuries with a reference to the "Historical Corpus of the Latvian Language". The resource is available for online browsing.

Name: Basic English-Maltese Dictionary
Description: This is a bilingual dictionary of alphabetically ordered English lemmas with their Maltese translation and Maltese pronunciation. The resource is unavailable for download or online browsing, but can be accessed by contacting the resource manager.

Name: Cologne Digital Sanskrit Dictionaries
Description:
This is a collection of 37 bilingual Sanskrit dictionaries originally published between 1832 and 1993. There are 11 Sanskrit-English, 3 English-Sanskrit, 2 Sanskrit-French, 5 Sanskrit-German, 1 Sanskrit-Latin, 2 Sanskrit-Sanskrit, and 10 specialized dictionaries.
The dictionaries are available for download and for online querying through a dedicated interface. Each dictionary has several types of display, as well as PDF scan and XML files for download.

Name: Dictionary of New Slovenian Words
Description: This is a dictionary of new words and neologisms. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI and for online browsing.

Name: English Hask Collocation Database
Description: HASK collocation dictionaries are phraseological databases used by linguists, language teachers, lexicographers, language materials developers, translators and other language professionals and casual dictionary users. The resource is available for online browsing through the PELCRA environment.

Name: The Estonian-Mari Dictionary
Description: This bilingual dictionary is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: English-Estonian Machine Translation Dictionary
Description: This is a constantly incremented English-Estonian online dictionary, which is helpful in both human and machine translation. The resource is available for online browsing.

Name: The Dictionary of Estonian Word Families - Index
Description: A word family consists of all the words that are linked by formative processes and share one and the same word stem. The resource is available for online browsing.

Name: Dictionary of Contemporary Dutch (ANW)
Description: This dictionary describes Dutch vocabulary from 1970 onwards. The resource is available for online browsing through a platform provided by the Dutch Language Institute (INT). For a list of related publications, see the following webpage.

Name: Estonian-Latvian Dictionary
Description: This is a bilingual dictionary that is available for online browsing.

Name: The Estonian-Latvian-Estonian Dictionary
Description: This bilingual dictionary is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: Dictionary of Slovenian Phrasemes
Description: This is a multiword lexicon available for download from CLARIN.SI and for online browsing through a dedicated environment.
Annotation: descriptions and explanations of Slovenian phrasemes

Name: electronic Dictionary of Dutch Dialects (eWND)
Description: The electronic Dictionary of Dutch Dialects (eWND) contains an ever-growing number of old and more modern Dutch dialect dictionaries. The website not only allows users to search the various dialect dictionaries through a common search interface, but also allows users to access and download all text editions individually. The resource is available for online browsing through the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: ISLEX
Description: This multilingual dictionary is available for download from CLARIN-IS as well as for online browsing.
Annotation: Icelandic headwords with pronunciation (sound files) and inflection; translations into Danish, Norwegian (Bokmål and Nynorsk), Swedish, Faroese

Name: Dictionary of the Slovenian Language in the Works of Janez Svetokriški
Description: This is a historical dictionary compiling the works of Janez Svetokriški. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI and for online browsing.

Name: Tezaurs.lv (2023 Summer Edition)
Description:
This is a comprehensive corpus-based dictionary of the Latvian language.
The resource is available for online browsing as well as for download from the CLARIN-LV repository.

Name: Estonian-Russian Learner's Orthographic Dictionary
Description: The Estonian-Russian Learner's dictionary is mainly meant for those learners of Estonian whose mother tongue is Russian or who learn it through Russian. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: The Russian-Estonian Dictionary
Description: This bilingual dictionary is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: Early Middle Dutch Dictionary (VMNW)
Description: This is a historical dictionary of Early Medieval Dutch vocabulary from the period between 1200 and 1300. The resource is available for online browsing through the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: Dictionary of Twitterese Janes-Dict 1.0
Description: This is a dictionary of computer-mediated communication appearing on Twitter. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI and for online browsing.

Name: The Dialectological Dictionary of Estonian
Description: This is a dictionary that provides a survey of Estonian dialect words and their areal distribution. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: Icelandic Pronunciation Dictionary
Description: This is a dictionary with pronunciation information for common Icelandic words. The resource is available for download from the CLARIN-IS repository.

Name: The Dictionary of the Hiiu Dialect
Description: This dialectal dictionary is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: Latvian-Latgalian Dictionary
Description: This is a bilingual dictionary that is available for online browsing.

Name: A Digital Dictionary of Tunis Arabic
Description: This dictionary includes entries from the TuniCo corpus and is additionally based on data elicited from complementary interviews with young Tunisians and lexical material taken from published historical sources dating back to the middle of the 20th century. The resource is available for download from ARCHE.

Name: The Dictionary of the Mulgi Dialect
Description: This is a dialectal dictionary searchable by keyword (in dialect spelling), standard Estonian equivalent (meaning) or style label. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: Wurdboek fan de Frsyke taal
Description: This dictionary describes the meaning and history of hundred thousands of words in written Frisian, from the period 1800–1976. The resource is available for online browsing through the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: Dictionary of Contemporary Finnish
Description: This is a dictionary of modern Finnish that is available for online browsing through the Language Bank of Finland.

Name: Kven-Norwegian Bokmål dictionary
Description: This is a bilingual dictionary that is available for download from CLARINO.

Name: Norwegian Bokmål-South Saami dictionary
Description: This is a bilingual dictionary that is available for download from CLARINO.

Name: Norwegian-Vietnamese Dictionary
Description: This is a bilingual dictionary that is available for download from CLARINO.

Name: The Dictionary of the Seto Dialect
Description: This is the first online Seto dictionary accessible to search both in dialect orthography and in simplified spelling (without diacritical marks). The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.
Annotation: dialect orthography and simplified spelling without diacritical marks

Name: The Estonian-Norwegian-Estonian Dictionary
Description: This bilingual dictionary is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: The Explanatory Dictionary of Estonian Language
Description: This is the biggest dictionary of the Estonian language, which covers Estonian standard language as a whole, including spoken language and special languages. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: Reverse dictionary of Slovenian language
Description: This is a dictionary where headwords are sorted by last-to-first letter. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI.

Name: Swedish-South Saami dictionary
Description: This is a bilingual dictionary that is available for download from CLARINO.

Name: The Basic Estonian Dictionary
Description: This is a monolingual dictionary that includes important Estonian words explained in simple language. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated webpage.

Name: Japanese-Slovene learner's dictionary jaSlo 3.1
Description: This is a learner’s dictionary for Slovenian students of Japanese. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI and for online browsing.

Name: The Dictionary of the Kihnu Dialect
Description: This is the first dictionary of the Hiiu vernacular. The entries also give sentence examples with reference to their source parish. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: Multilingual dictionaries
Description: This is a collection of dictionaries created on the basis of Wikipedia articles. The collection is available for download from clarin:el.

Name: Polish Hask Collocation Database
Description: HASK collocation dictionaries are phraseological databases used by linguists, language teachers, lexicographers, language materials developers, translators and other language professionals and casual dictionary users. The resource is available for online browsing through the PELCRA environment.

Name: Dictionary of Middle Dutch (MNW)
Description: This is a historical dictionary of Medieval Dutch vocabulary from the period between 1250 and 1550. The resource is available for online browsing through the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: Jysk Ordbog (a-h), 17. April, 2011, xml-edition
Description: This is a dictionary of Danish dialects spoken in Jutland between 1700 and 1920. The resource is available for download from CLARIN-DK.

Name: Lithuanian-Latvian-Latgalian Dictionary (LLL)
Description: This is a trilingual dictionary that is available for online browsing through a dedicated environment.

Name: The Dictionary of Estonian Antonyms
Description: This dictionary contains antonym pairs, most of which belong to general language. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: A digital dictionary of Modern Standard Arabic
Description: This small-sized dictionary of Modern Standard Arabic has mainly been compiled for comparative and didactic purposes. The resource is available for download from ARCHE.
Annotation: basic morphological information, a few usage examples

Name: Russian-Latvian Dictionary
Description: This is a bilingual dictionary that is available for online browsing.

Name: Finnish-Estonian Dictionary
Description: This is the web-version of the two-volume Finnish-Estonian Dictionary (2003). The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: A Dictionary of Contemporary Icelandic
Description: The dictionary, which is based on the multilingual ISLEX dictionary, describes Icelandic vocabulary from around 1950 up to the present date. Important words belonging to older stages of the language are also included, in addition to Old Icelandic words that students may encounter in their studies (such as bolöxi, fjörbaugsgarður, hjálmvölur and jarteikn). New words are added to the dictionary now and then and the definitions and examples are constantly being updated. All headwords have links to sound files with their pronunciation, and inflections are shown by links to the Database of Modern Icelandic Inflection. This dictionary is available for download from the CLARIN.IS repository and for online browsing through a dedicated interface.

Name: Dictionary of Old Literary Finnish
Description: This is a dictionary of Old Literary Finish. The resource is available for online browsing through the Language Bank of Finland.

Name: Universal Dependencies 2.5 Models for UDPipe
Description: These models are for the Universal Dependencies 2.5 treebanks (94 treebanks of 61 languages). In addition to dependency parsing, the models are also for toeknisation, part-of-speech tagging and lemmatisation. The models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: POS-tagging model: Marmot
Description: This is a set of 2 models. marmot_eval is trained on SUC3 and the Talbanken_SBX_dev treebank, using Saldo as dictionary. marmot_full is trained on SUC3, the Talbanken_SBX_dev treebank, and SIC2 (with Saldo as dictionary). The models are available for download from the Swedish Language Bank.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for lemmatisation of standard Croatian 2.1
Description: The model for lemmatisation of standard Croatian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the hr500k training corpus and using the hrLex inflectional lexicon. The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~98.02. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Face-domain-specific automatic speech recognition models
Description: This model contains all the files required to implement face-domain-specific automatic speech recognition (ASR) applications using the Kaldi ASR toolkit, including the acoustic model, language model, and other relevant files. It also includes all the scripts and configuration files needed to use these models for implementing face-domain-specific automatic speech recognition. The acoustic model was trained using the relevant Kaldi ASR tools and the Artur speech corpus (audio,transcriptions). The language model was trained using the domain-specific text data involving face descriptions obtained by translating the Face2Text English dataset into the Slovenian language. These models, combined with other necessary files like the HCLG.fst and decoding scripts, enable the implementation of face-domain-specific ASR applications. This resource is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: WMT21 Marian translation models (ca-ro,it,oc)
Description: This is a translation model from Catalan into Romanian, Italian, and Occitan that was part of the submission for WMT21 Multilingual Low-Resource Translation for Indo-European Languages Shared Task. The model is available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for morphosyntactic annotation of non-standard Croatian 2.1
Description: The model for morphosyntactic annotation of non-standard Croatian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the hr500k training corpus and the ReLDI-NormTagNER-hr corpus, using the CLARIN.SI-embed.hr word embeddings. These corpora were additionally augmented for handling missing diacritics by repeating parts of the corpora with diacritics removed. The model produces simultaneously UPOS, FEATS and XPOS (MULTEXT-East) labels. The estimated F1 of the XPOS annotations is ~92.49. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Lemmatization model: Stanza
Description:
This model enables lemmatisation of Swedish text following the SUC3 standard.
The models are available for download from the Swedish Language Bank.

Name: Gervásio PT-BR base
Description: This model, which is for Portuguese spoken in Brazil, is a decoder of the GPT family that is based on the neural architecture Transformer and developed over the Pythia model. The model is available for download from Hugging Face.

Name: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for named entity recognition of standard Bulgarian 1.0
Description: This model for named entity recognition of standard Bulgarian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the BulTreeBank training corpus and using the CoNLL2017 word embeddings. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Liner2.6 model NER NKJP
Description: This is a Liner2 model for the recognition of named entities. The model was trained on the NKJP corpus and evaluated in the PolEval 2018 Task 2. The model is available for download from the CLARIN-PL repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Serbian 2.1
Description: The model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Serbian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the SETimes.SR training corpus combined with the Croatian hr500k training dataset to ensure sufficient representation of certain labels, and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sr word embeddings. The model produces simultaneously UPOS, FEATS and XPOS (MULTEXT-East) labels. The estimated F1 of the XPOS annotations is ~96.19. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: BERTimbau - Portuguese BERT-Large language model
Description: This is a BERT model, trained on BrWaC (Brazilian Web as Corpus), a large Portuguese corpus, for 1,000,000 steps, using whole-word mask. The model is available for download from the PORTULAN repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for named entity recognition of standard Slovenian 1.0
Description: This model for named entity recognition of standard Slovenian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the ssj500k training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sl word embeddings. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: CUBBITT Translation Models (en-pl) (v1.0)
Description: These are CUBBITT English-Polish translation models available in the LINDAT translation service. The models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: CERED baseline models
Description: These models are trained on CERED, a dataset created by distant supervision on Czech Wikipedia and Wikidata, and recognize a subset of Wikidata relations. The model is available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: LX-DSemVectors
Description:
This model represents tokens as contextual  word embeddings for Portuguese. It was trained on a corpus of 2 billion tokens and achieved state-of-the-art results on multiple lexical semantic tasks.
The model is available for download from the PORTULAN repository.

Name: Albertina PT-PT
Description: This model is an encoder of the BERT family and is based on the neural architecture Transformer and developed over the DeBERTa model. This model is for European Portuguese and is trained on the brWaC dataset, and is a larger version of the Albertina PT-PT base model. This model is available for download through Hugging Face.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Slovenian 2.0
Description: The model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Slovenian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the SUK training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sl word embeddings expanded with the MaCoCu-sl Slovene web corpus.The model produces simultaneously UPOS, FEATS and XPOS (MULTEXT-East) labels. The estimated F1 of the XPOS annotations is ~98.27. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for named entity recognition of standard Serbian 1.0
Description: This model for named entity recognition of standard Serbian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the SETimes.SR training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sr word embeddings. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Dependency parsing models for Polish
Description: These models are trained on the 3.5 version of the Polish Dependency Treebank with the publicly available parsing systems: MaltParser, MateParser, and UDPipe. The models are available for download from the CLARIN-PL repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Bulgarian 2.1
Description: The model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Bulgarian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the BulTreeBank training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.bg word embeddings. The model produces simultaneously UPOS, FEATS and XPOS (MULTEXT-East) labels. The estimated F1 of the XPOS annotations is ~96.83. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: RÚV-DI Speaker Diarization v5 models (21.05)
Description: These models are trained on the Althingi Parliamentary Speech corpus hosted by CLARIN-IS. The models use MFCCS, x-vectors, PLDA and AHC The models are available for download from the CLARIN-IS repository.

Name: Word embeddings CLARIN.SI-embed
Description:
This is a set of word embeddings for 5 languages.
  • CLARIN.SI-embed.bg contains word embeddings for Bulgarian induced from the MaCoCu-bg web crawl corpus. The embeddings are based on the skip-gram model of fastText trained on 4,120,343,820 tokens of running text for 2,746,640 lowercased surface forms.
  • CLARIN.SI-embed.hr contains word embeddings induced from a large collection of Croatian texts composed of the Croatian web corpus hrWaC, a 400-million-token-heavy collection of newspaper texts and MaCoCu-hr. The embeddings are based on the skip-gram model of fastText trained on 4,586,769,197 tokens of running text for 3,406,574 lowercased surface forms.
  • CLARIN.SI-embed.mk contains word embeddings induced from a large collection of Macedonian texts crawled from the .mk top-level domain. The embeddings are based on the skip-gram model of fastText trained on 933,231,582 tokens of running text for 986,670 lowercased surface forms.
  • CLARIN.SI-embed.sr contains word embeddings induced from the srWaC and MaCoCu-sr web corpora. The embeddings are based on the skip-gram model of fastText trained on 3,434,602,575 tokens of running text for 2,676,036 lowercased surface forms.
  • CLARIN.SI-embed.sl contains word embeddings induced from a large collection of Slovene texts composed of existing corpora of Slovene, e.g GigaFida, Janes, KAS, slWaC, MaCoCu-sl, etc. The embeddings are based on the skip-gram model of fastText trained on 5,791,405,942 tokens of running text for 3,471,054 lowercased surface forms.
The models are available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Liner2.5 model Timex
Description: This is a model for the Liner2.5 tool for the recognition and normalization on temporal expressions.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN-PL repository.

Name: Translation Models (en-ru) (v1.0)
Description: These are CUBBITT English-Russiantranslation models available in the LINDAT translation service. The models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: Translation Models (English-German)
Description: These English-German translation models are used by the Lindat translation service. The models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: CoNLL 2017 Shared Task - UDPipe Baseline Models and Supplementary Materials
Description: These are models for the dependency parser UDPipe, developed as part of the CoNLL 2017 Shared Task in UD Parsing. The models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: FinBERT
Description: This BERT model can be fine-tuned to achieve state-of-the-art results for various Finnish natural language processing tasks. The model is available for download from the Language Bank of Finland.

Name: Slavic Forest, Norwegian Wood (models)
Description: These are models for the dependency parser UDPipe used to produce the authors' final submission to the Vardial 2017 CLP shared task. The scripts and commands used to create the models are part of a separate LINDAT repository entry. The models were trained with UDPipe version 3e65d69 from 3 January 2017; their functionality with newer or older versions of UDPipe is not guaranteed. The models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: GreynirTranslate - mBART25 NMT (with layer drop) models for Translations between Icelandic and English (1.0)
Description: These are a variant of GreynirTranslate - mBART25 NMT models for Translations between Icelandic and English (1.0), trained with a 40% layer drop. They are suitable for inference using every other layer for optimized inference speed with lower translation performance. These models are available for download from the repository of CLARIN-IS.

Name: WMT21 Marian translation model (ca-oc)
Description: This is a neural machine translation model for Catalan to Occitan translation and constitutes the primary CUNI submission for WMT21 Multilingual Low-Resource Translation for Indo-European Languages Shared Task. The model is available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for UD dependency parsing of standard Slovenian 2.0
Description: The model for UD dependency parsing of standard Slovenian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the SUK training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sl word embeddings expanded with the MaCoCu-sl Slovene web corpus. The estimated LAS of the parser is ~91.11. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for named entity recognition of non-standard Slovenian 1.0
Description: This model for named entity recognition of non-standard Slovenian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the ssj500k training corpus and the Janes-Tag training corpus, using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sl word embeddings. The training corpora were additionally augmented for handling missing diacritics by repeating parts of the corpora with diacritics removed. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for UD dependency parsing of standard Bulgarian 2.1
Description: The model for UD dependency parsing of standard Bulgarian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the UD-parsed portion of the BulTreeBank training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.bg word embeddings. The estimated LAS of the parser is ~91.18. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for lemmatisation of non-standard Croatian 2.1
Description: The model for lemmatisation of non-standard Croatian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the hr500k training corpus and the ReLDI-NormTagNER-hr corpus, using the hrLex inflectional lexicon. These corpora were additionally augmented for handling missing diacritics by repeating parts of the corpora with diacritics removed. The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~94.23. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Macedonian 2.1
Description: The model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Macedonian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the 1984 training corpus expanded with the Macedonian SETimes corpus (to be published) and using the Macedonian CLARIN.SI word embeddings. The model produces simultaneously UPOS, FEATS and XPOS (MULTEXT-East) labels. The estimated F1 of the XPOS annotations is ~97.14. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Model weights for a study of commonsense reasoning
Description: This resource contains model weights for five Transformer-based models: roBERTa, GPT-2, T5, BART and COMET.These models were implemented using HuggingFace, and fine-tuned on the following four commonsense reasoning tasks: Argument Reasoning Comprehension Task (ARCT), AI2 Reasoning Challenge (ARC), Physical Interaction Question Answering (PIQA) and CommonsenseQA (CSQA). The models are available for download form the PORTULAN repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for named entity recognition of non-standard Serbian 1.0
Description: This model for named entity recognition of non-standard Serbian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the SETimes.SR training corpus/a>, the hr500k training corpus, the ReLDI-NormTagNER-sr corpus, and the ReLDI-NormTagNER-hr corpus, using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sr word embeddings. The training corpora were additionally augmented for handling missing diacritics by repeating parts of the corpora with diacritics removed. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for UD dependency parsing of standard Serbian 2.1
Description: The model for UD dependency parsing of standard Serbian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the SETimes.SR training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sr word embeddings.The estimated LAS of the parser is ~89.83. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: PyTorch model for Slovenian Coreference Resolution
Description: This is a Slovenian model for coreference resolution: a neural network based on a customized transformer architecture, usable with this code. The model is based on the Slovenian CroSloEngual BERT 1.1 model. It was trained on the SUK 1.0 training corpus, specifically the SentiCoref subcorpus. This resource is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Albertina PT-BR base
Description: This model is for Portuguese spoken in Brazil. It is based on the Transformer neural architecture and is developed over the DeBERTa model.

Name: Universal Dependencies 1.2 Models for Parsito
Description: These are models for the dependency parser Parsito. They are trained on Universal Dependencies 1.2 Treebanks.

Name: CoNLL 2018 Shared Task - UDPipe Baseline Models and Supplementary Materials
Description: This is a baseline model for UDPipe (version 1.2 and up), created for the CoNLL 2018 Shared Task in UD Parsing. The models were trained using a custom data split for treebanks where no development data is provided. The model is available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: GreynirT2T Serving - En--Is NMT Inference and Pre-trained Models (1.0)
Description: This CLARIN-IS repository entry includes code and models required to run the GreynirT2T Transformer NMT system for translation between English and Icelandic. The models along with the code are available for download from the CLARIN-IS repository.

Name: BERTimbau - Portuguese BERT-Base language model
Description: This is a BERT model, trained on BrWaC (Brazilian Web as Corpus), a large Portuguese corpus, for 1,000,000 steps, using whole-word mask. The model is available for download from the PORTULAN repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for JOS dependency parsing of standard Slovenian 2.0
Description: The model for JOS dependency parsing of standard Slovenian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the SUK training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sl word embeddings expanded with the MaCoCu-sl Slovene web corpus. The estimated LAS of the parser is ~93.89. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Czech Models for Korektor 2
Description: These models are for the statistical spellchecker Korektor 2. The models can either perform spellchecking and grammar-checking, or only generate diacritical marks. The models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: Gervásio PT-PT base
Description: This model, which is for European Portuguese, is a decoder of the GPT family that is based on the neural architecture Transformer and developed over the Pythia model. The model is available for download from Hugging Face.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for lemmatisation of standard Macedonian 2.1
Description: The model for lemmatisation of standard Macedonian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the 1984 training corpus expanded with the Macedonian SETimes corpus (to be published). The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~98.81. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for semantic role labeling of standard Slovenian 2.0
Description: The model for lemmatisation of standard Slovenian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the SUK training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sl word embeddings extended with the MaCoCu-sl Slovene web corpus. The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~76.24. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Liner2.5 model NER
Description: This is a model for the Liner 2.5 tool. #SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN-PL repository.

Name: Liner2.5 model Minos
Description: This is a model for the Liner2.5 tool for the recognition of verbs without explicit subjects. The model is available for download from the CLARIN-PL repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for lemmatisation of non-standard Slovenian 2.1
Description: The model for lemmatisation of non-standard Slovenian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the SUK training corpus and on the Janes-Tag corpus using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sl word embeddings expanded with the MaCoCu-sl Slovene web corpus. These corpora were additionally augmented for handling missing diacritics by repeating parts of the corpora with diacritics removed. The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~91.45. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: CUBBITT Translation Models (en-cs) (v1.0)
Description: These English-Czech translation models are used by the . The model is available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: LVBERT - Latvian BERT
Description: This model is trained on the original implementation of BERT on the TensorFlow machine-learning platform with the whole-word masking and the next sentence prediction objectives. This uses the BERT configuration with 12 layers, 768 hidden units, 12 heads, 128 sequence length, 128 mini-batch size and a 32,000 token vocabulary. THe model is available for download from the CLARIN-LV repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for named entity recognition of non-standard Croatian 1.0
Description: This model for named entity recognition of non-standard Croatian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the hr500k training corpus, the ReLDI-NormTagNER-hr corpus and the ReLDI-NormTagNER-sr corpus, using the CLARIN.SI-embed.hr word embeddings . The training corpora were additionally augmented for handling missing diacritics by repeating parts of the corpora with diacritics removed. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for UD dependency parsing of standard Croatian 2.1
Description: The model for UD dependency parsing of standard Croatian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the UD-parsed portion of the hr500k training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.hr word embeddings.The estimated LAS of the parser is ~87.46. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Word Embeddings trained on English Wikipedia
Description:
This is a set of contextual word embeddings.
The models are available for download from the Swedish Language Bank.

Name: English Model (CoNLL-2003) for NameTag
Description: This is an English model for NameTag, a named entity recognition tool. The model is trained on CoNLL-2003 training data and recognizes PER, ORG, LOC and MISC named entities. It achieves an F-measure 84.73 on the CoNLL-2003 test data. The model is available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: Sentiment Analysis (Czech Model)
Description: These models are trained on data from the following sources: Mall (product reviews), CSFD (movie reviews), and Facebook, and joint data from all three datasets above (data available here, using RobeCzech, which is the Czech version of BERT.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for lemmatisation of non-standard Serbian 2.1
Description: The model for lemmatisation of non-standard Serbian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the SETimes.SR training corpus combined with the Serbian non-standard training corpus ReLDI-NormTagNER-sr and using the srLex inflectional lexicon. These corpora were additionally augmented for handling missing diacritics by repeating parts of the corpora with diacritics removed. The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~94.92. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Czech Models (MorfFlex CZ 161115 + PDT 3.0) for MorphoDiTa 161115
Description: These models were developed for MorphoDiTa, which performs morphological analysis, morphological generation and part-of-speech tagging (see also the PoS-taggers and lemmatizers Resource Family). The morphological dictionary is created from the 161115 version of the MorfFlex CZ lexicon and the 1.2 version of the DeriNet lexical network. The PoS tagger is trained on Prague Dependency Treebank 3.0. The models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: NameTag 2 Models
Description: These models are for NameTag 2, a named entity recognition tool (see also the Named Entity Recognizers Resource Family). The documentation is available separately on the project webpage. The models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: Albertina PT-BR No-brWaC
Description: This is a model for Portuguese spoken in Brazil trained on adta sets othan than brWaC. It is I developed over the DeBERTa model. The model is available for download from Hugging Face.

Name: Models for automatic g2p for Icelandic (20.10)
Description: These are grapheme-to-phoneme models for Icelandic, trained on an encoder-decoder LSTM neural network. The models are delivered with scripts for automatic transcription of Icelandic in the standard pronunciation variation, in the northern variation, north-east variation, and the south variation. To run the scripts the user needs to install Fairseq.

Name: CUBBITT Translation Models (en-fr) (v1.0)
Description: These are CUBBITT English-French translation models available in the LINDAT translation service. The models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: POS Tagging and Lemmatization (Czech model)
Description: This model is trained using RobeCzech, which is the Czech version of BERT. The model is trained on the Prague Dependency Treebank 3.5. The model is available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: WMT16 Tuning Shared Task Models (Czech-to-English)
Description: These Czech to English translation models are trained on the parallel CzEng 1.6 corpus. The data is tokenized with Moses). Alignment is done using fast_align and the standard Moses pipeline is used for training. The models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: Czech image captioning, machine translation, sentiment analysis and summarization (Neural Monkey models)
Description: These models are for the Neural Monkey toolkit for Czech and English, solving four NLP tasks: machine translation, image captioning, sentiment analysis, and summarization. The models are trained on standard datasets and achieve state-of-the-art or near state-of-the-art performance in the tasks. The same models can also be invoked via an online demo. This entry also includes models for automatic news summarization for Czech and English. The Czech models were trained using the SumeCzech dataset, while the English models were trained using the CNN-Daily Mail corpus, using the standard recurrent sequence-to-sequence architecture. The models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: MCSQ Translation Models (en-de) (v1.0)
Description: These are English-German translation models available in the LINDAT translation service. The models are trained using the MCSQ social surveys dataset (available here ). The models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: Slovenian RoBERTa contextual embeddings model: SloBERTa 2.0
Description: The monolingual Slovene RoBERTa (A Robustly Optimized Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers) model is a state-of-the-art model representing words/tokens as contextually dependent word embeddings, used for various NLP tasks. Word embeddings can be extracted for every word occurrence and then used in training a model for an end task, but typically the whole RoBERTa model is fine-tuned end-to-end.

Name: English Models (Morphium + WSJ) for MorphoDiTa
Description: These models are for MorphoDiTa, which performs morphological analysis, morphological generation and part-of-speech tagging (see also the PoS-taggers and lemmatizers Resource Family). The morphological dictionary is created from Morphium and SCOWL (Spell Checker Oriented Word Lists), the PoS tagger is trained on the Wall Street Journal.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for lemmatisation of standard Bulgarian 2.1
Description: The model for lemmatisation of standard Bulgarian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the BulTreeBank training corpus and using the Bulgarian inflectional lexicon (Popov, Simov, and Vidinska 1998). The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~98.93. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: MCSQ Translation Models (en-ru) (v1.0)
Description: These are English-Russian translation models available in the LINDAT translation service. The models are trained using the MCSQ social surveys dataset (available here ). The models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: POS-tagging model: Flair
Description: This is a set of 2 models. flair_eval is trained on SUC3 with Talbanken_SBX_devas dev set. The advantage of this model is that it can be evaluated, using Talbanken_SBX_test or SIC2. flair_full is trained on SUC3, Talbanken_SBX_test, SIC2 with Talbanken_SBX_dev as dev set. The models are available for download from the Swedish Language Bank.

Name: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for named entity recognition of standard Croatian 1.0
Description: This model for named entity recognition of standard Croatian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the hr500k training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.hr word embeddings. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for morphosyntactic annotation of non-standard Slovenian 2.1
Description: The model for morphosyntactic annotation of non-standard Slovenian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the SUK training corpus and on the Janes-Tag corpus using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sl word embeddings expanded with the MaCoCu-sl Slovene web corpus. These corpora were additionally augmented for handling missing diacritics by repeating parts of the corpora with diacritics removed. The model produces simultaneously UPOS, FEATS and XPOS (MULTEXT-East) labels. The estimated F1 of the XPOS annotations is ~92.17. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Portuguese RoBERTa language model
Description: This is a pre-trained roBERTa model in Portuguese, with 6 layers and 12 attention-heads, totaling 68M parameters. Pre-training was done on 10 million Portuguese sentences and 10 million English sentences from the OSCAR corpus. The model is available for download from the PORUTLAN repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for morphosyntactic annotation of non-standard Serbian 2.1
Description: The model for morphosyntactic annotation of non-standard Serbian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the SETimes.SR training corpus combined with the Serbian non-standard training corpus ReLDI-NormTagNER-sr and the hr500k training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sr word embeddings. These corpora were additionally augmented for handling missing diacritics by repeating parts of the corpora with diacritics removed. The model produces simultaneously UPOS, FEATS and XPOS (MULTEXT-East) labels. The estimated F1 of the XPOS annotations is ~92.64. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Albertina PT-BR
Description: This model is an encoder of the BERT family and is based on the neural architecture Transformer and developed over the DeBERTa model. This model is for American Portuguese spoken in Brazil, is trained on the brWaC dataset, and is a larger version of the Albertina PT-BR base model. This model is available for download through Hugging Face.

Name: UDify Pretrained Model
Description: UDify is a single model that parses Universal Dependencies (UPOS, UFeats, Lemmas, Deps) jointly, accepting any of 75 supported languages as input (trained on UD v2.3 with 124 treebanks).

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Croatian 2.1
Description: The model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Croatian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the hr500k training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.hr word embeddings. The model produces simultaneously UPOS, FEATS and XPOS (MULTEXT-East) labels. The estimated F1 of the XPOS annotations is ~94.87. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Dataset and baseline model of moderated content FRENK-MMC-RTV 1.0
Description: FRENK-MMC-RTV is a dataset of moderated newspaper comments from the website rtvslo.si with metadata on the time of publishing, user identifier, thread identifier and whether the comment was deleted by the moderators or not. The full text of each comment is encrypted via a character-replacement method so that the comments are not readable by humans. Basic punctuation is not encrypted in order to enable tokenization. The main use of this dataset are experiments on automating comment moderation. For real-world usage, a fastText classification model trained on non-encrypted data is made available as well. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: ELMo embeddings models for seven languages
Description:
This model is used to produce contextual word embeddings. It is trained on large monolingual corpora for 7 languages. Each language's model was trained for approximately 10 epochs. Corpora sizes used in training range from over 270 M tokens in Latvian to almost 2 B tokens in Croatian. About 1 million most common tokens were provided as vocabulary during the training for each language model. The model can also infer OOV words, since the neural network input is on the character level.
The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Czech Models (CNEC) for NameTag
Description: These are models for the named entity recognizer NameTag. The models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: WMT21 Marian translation model (ca-oc multi-task)
Description: This is a neural machine translation model for Catalan to Occitan translation. It is a multi-task model, also producing phonemic transcription of the Catalan source. The model was submitted to WMT21 Multilingual Low-Resource Translation for Indo-European Languages Shared Task as a CUNI-Contrastive system for Catalan to Occitan. The model is available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: CroSloEngual BERT 1.1
Description:
Trilingual BERT (Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers) model, trained on Croatian, Slovenian, and English data. State of the art tool representing words/tokens as contextually dependent word embeddings, used for various NLP classification tasks by finetuning the model end-to-end. CroSloEngual BERT are neural network weights and configuration files in pytorch format (i.e. to be used with pytorch library).
The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for lemmatisation of standard Slovenian 2.0
Description: The model for lemmatisation of standard Slovenian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the SUK training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sl word embeddings expanded with the MaCoCu-sl Slovene web corpus. The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~99.7. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: ccGigafida ARPA language model 1.0
Description: This model was created from the ccGigafida written corpus of Slovenian using the KenLM algorithm in the Moses machine translation framework. It is a general language model of contemporary standard Slovenian language that can be used as a language model in statistical machine translation systems. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Albertina PT-PT base
Description: This model is for European. It is based on the Transformer neural architecture and is developed over the DeBERTa model. This model is available for download through Hugging Face.

Name: Liner2.5 model Events
Description: This is a model for the Liner2.5 tool for the recognition of event mentions. The model is available for download from the CLARIN-PL repository.

Name: POS-tagging model: Stanza
Description: This is a set of 2 models. stanza_eval is trained on SUC3 and the Talbanken_SBX_dev treebank. stanza_full is trained on the SUC3, Talbanken_SBX_test, and SIC2 sets, with Talbanken_SBX_dev as dev set. The models are available for download from the Swedish Language Bank.

Name: PyTorch model for Slovenian Named Entity Recognition SloNER 1.0
Description: This is a model for Slovenian Named Entity Recognition. It is is a PyTorch neural network model, intended for usage with the HuggingFace transformers library . The model is based on the Slovenian RoBERTa contextual embeddings model SloBERTa 2.0. The model was trained on the SUK 1.0 training corpus.The source code of the model is available on GitHub repository. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: The CLASSLA-Stanza model for lemmatisation of standard Serbian 2.1
Description: The model for lemmatisation of standard Serbian was built with the CLASSLA-Stanza tool by training on the SETimes.SR training corpus combined with the Serbian non-standard training corpus ReLDI-NormTagNER-sr and using the srLex inflectional lexicon. The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~98.02. The model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Slovak MorphoDiTa Models 170914
Description: These are Slovak models for MorphoDiTa, a tool which provides morphological analysis, morphological generation and part-of-speech tagging. The morphological dictionary is created from MorfFlex (SK 170914) and the PoS tagger is trained on automatic translations in Prague Dependency Treebank 3.0. The models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Name: Glossary of Medical Terms
Description: This is a glossary of medical terms. The resource is available for download from clarin:el.

Name: Multilingual lexicon of toponyms
Description: This is a glossary of toponyms available for download from clarin:el.
Language: Polish + translations into English, Romanian, Hungarian, Bulgarian, Polish, Greek, German, Serbian, Slovak, Croatian

Name: MFSA_Maltese_Company_Registry
Description: This glossary is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: Termoteca
Description:
This glossary contains t from different sciences and industries - ecology, economy, law, sociology, medecine, tourism, and computation.
The glossary is available from PORTULAN.

Name: Terminological multiword expressions lexicon
Description: This lexicon contains multiword terms extracted from various terminological sources. The entries were lemmatized and tagged according to the MULTEXT-East specifications for Slovenian, and manually checked and corrected. The lexicon is distributed as a TSV file, one line for each multiword term. The first column contains the term in its canonical form, the second the lemmas of its words, and the third the MULTEXT-East morphosyntactic descriptions. This resource is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: The Dictionary of Education
Description: This is a comprehensive glossary of education terminology. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: Time-sensitive inventory of medical terminology
Description: This glossary is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: Greek-French lexicon of football
Description: This is a glossary of football terms available for download from clarin:el.

Name: Glossary e-book "Open Linked Data and Applications"
Description: This glossary is available for download from clarin:el.

Name: English for business
Description: This glossary includes terms from the domains of economics and business administration. The resource is available for download from CLARINO.

Name: Name Component Lexicon
Description: This is a glossary of the most common elements out of which Swedish place names are built. The resource is available online through FIN-CLARIN.

Name: Glossary of feminist theory
Description: This is a glossary of terms related to Feminist theory/criticism, and gender theory. The resource is available for download from clarin:el.

Name: Pan-Latin Smart City Lexicon
Description: This terminological glossary, which is developed with the Realiter network, contains terms related to the Smart City concept. The lexicon can be downloaded from the ILC4CLARIN repository.

Name: INT IMPACT NE Lexicon
Description: This is a glossary that features historical names and variants for the period between 1750 and 1945. The resource is available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: The English-Estonian Maritime Dictionary
Description: This glossary contains nautical terms. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: The Dictionary of the Clothing Terminology of the Zilja Dialect in Canale Valley (Kanalska dolina – Val Canale – Kanaltal – Valcjanâl)
Description: This is a term dictionary of Clothing Terminology of the Zilja Dialect spoken in the Val Canale Valley. Entries in the dictionary are equipped with sound clips and illustrative photographs of traditional clothing items. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI and for online browsing.

Name: Dictionary of Estonian Place Names
Description: This etymological glossary contains all official village names of Estonia and selected group of other Estonian place names. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: A Terminological Inventory for Biodiversity
Description: This is a glossary of animal species available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN and online browsing.

Name: Xenophobia
Description: This is a collection of 12 knowledge bases on various forms of xenophobia, available for download from clarin:el.

Name: The Family Name Database of the Institute of the Estonian Language
Description: This glossary is available for online browsing.

Name: Pan-Latin Lexicon of Collars and Sleeves in Fashion and Costume
Description: This terminological glossary, which is developed with the Realiter network, contains terms related to fashion. This lexicon can be downloaded from the ILC4CLARIN repository.

Name: Pan-Latin Geothermal Energy Lexicon
Description: This terminological glossary, which is developed with the Realiter network, contains terms related to geothermal energy. This lexicon can be downloaded from the ILC4CLARIN repository.

Name: The Place Name Database of the Institute of the Estonian Language (KNAB)
Description: This glossary is available for online browsing.

Name: Τρίγλωσσο Ορολογικό Λεξικό (ΤΟΛ)
Description: This is a trilingual term glossary for foreign students who want to improve their language skills in Greek and familiarize themselves with information technology. The resource is available for download from clarin:el.

Name: Pinkhof Medical Dictionary
Description: The Pinkhof Medical Dictionary contains more than 52,000 medical terms with their meanings and/or references. The resource is available for online browsing through a platform provided by the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: Greek Crisis Multilingual Term Project
Description: This is a glossary of terms related to the Greek government-debt crisis. The resource is available for download from clarin:el.

Name: Multilingual glossary (Department of Foreign Languages, Translation and Interpretation)
Description: This is a general-purpose glossary that is available for download from clarin:el.

Name: UHR's Termbase for Norwegian higher education institutions
Description: This is a database of terms available for download from CLARINO and for online browsing.

Name: Netterms. Computer networking terminology
Description: This is glossary of terms related to computer networking available for download from clarin:el.

Name: Glossary of Ancient Greek dramaturgy
Description: This is a glossary of terms related to Ancient Greek Dramaturgy. The resource is available for download from clarin:el.

Name: ESTERM (20190101)
Description: This is a termbase that includes terms mainly from the legal acts of the Republic of Estonia and the European Union. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: MILITERM (20180801)
Description: MILITERM is a multilingual termbase of military, security and defence terms, enabling search by Estonian, English, French and German keywords. The Estonian and English terms are provided with definitions. The resource is available for online browsing.

Name: The Helsinki Term Bank for the Arts and Sciences
Description: This is a terminological database available for online browsing through FIN-CLARIN.

Name: Norwegian biodiversity terminology database
Description: This glossary includes terms from the domains of biology. The resource is available for download from CLARINO.

Name: PANACEA Environment Bilingual Glossary EL-EN (Greek-English)
Description: This glossary is available for download from clarin:el.

Name: Bibterms. Glossary of archive and library sciences
Description: This is a glossary of archival library science terms. The resource is available for download from clarin:el.

Name: Orossimo Terminological Resource
Description: This is a glossary of terms from various domains e.g. History, Computer Science, Biology etc. The resource is available for download from clarin:el.

Name: French-greek and greek-french lexicon of football terms
Description: This bilingual glossary of football terminology is available for download from clarin:el.

Name: Pan-Latin Photovoltaic Systems Lexicon
Description: This terminological glossary, which is developed with the Realiter network, contains terms related to photovoltaic systems. The lexicon can be downloaded from the ILC4CLARIN repository.

Name: MULTEXT-East free lexicons 4.0
Description: These are morphological lexica available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: PAROLE Portuguese Lexicon
Description: This is a morphosyntactic lexicon available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN

Name: Concreteness and imageability lexicon MEGA.HR-Crossling
Description: These lexica contain concreteness and imageability predictions for 77 languages. They are available for download from CLARIN.SI.

Name: A machine-readable Persian-English dictionary
Description: This bilingual lexicon has been compiled for comparative as well as didactic purposes in the on-going VICAV project. The resource is available for download from ARCHE.

Name: ParaDi 2.0
Description: This is a lexicon of single-word paraphrases of Czech verbal multiword expressions. The resource is available for download from LINDAT.

Name: Simple Portuguese Lexicon
Description: This semantic lexicon is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: QTLeap specialized lexicons
Description: This lexicon is used for the automatic translation of specific IT domain expressions and is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: VALLEX 3.0
Description: This is a valency lexicon available for download and online browsing through LINDAT.
Annotation: verb senses (characterized by glosses and examples)

Name: DVPM-EtyMor
Description:
This is a lexical database focussing on the typology and morphology of verbs in medieval Portuguese.
The lexicon is available from PORTULAN.

Name: LX-StopWords
Description: This is a manually compiled exhaustive list of closed-class words in Portuguese. The resource is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: Collocation lexicon of Slovene academic discourse Aleks
Description: This is a lexicon of entries typical for general Slovene academic discourse. The entries include typical context examples (collocations and examples of use) taken from KAS, a corpus of Slovene academic texts (see also the Academic corpora resource family), i.e. a morphosyntactically tagged synchronous and monolingual corpus, containing more than 1.5 billion words.#SEPThe resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI

Name: Basiscript Lexicon
Description: This is a lexicon that comprises all lemmas from the Basiscript Corpus. The Basiscript Corpus is an annotated collection of texts written by children in elementary school. The resource is available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: Italian Function Words v3
Description: This is a morphological lexicon. The resource is available for download from LINDAT.

Name: MWELexicon 1.1
Description: This is a lexicon of multiword expressions available for download from CLARIN.PL.

Name: LX-DSemVectors
Description: This lexicon provides distributional semantic representations of Portuguese words. The dataset is available for download from GitHub.

Name: Port-AoA Words
Description:
This is a lexicon of words classified according to several psycholinguistic characteristics, such as neighborhood density, written-word frequency, familiarity, and imageability.
The lexicon is available from PORTULAN.

Name: LX-Abbreviations
Description: This is a lexicon of abbreviations. The resource is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: LX-SimLex-999
Description: This is a word-similarity lexicon. The resource is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: OMBI Dutch-Arabic
Description: This is a bilingual lexicon that is suitable for language technology applications such as automatic translation, e-learning, multilingual information retrieval, etc. The resource is available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: LX-Rare Word Similarity Dataset
Description: This is a word-similarity lexicon available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: ViPER verb lexical database
Description:
This is a database of verb senses that includes their structural, distributional, and transformational properties.
The lexicon is available from PORTULAN.

Name: LX-WordSim-353
Description: This is a word-similarity lexicon. The resource is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: MarsaLex
Description: This is a morphological lexicon available for download from ORTOLANG.

Name: CzEngClass 0.2
Description: This is a valency lexicon linked to PDT-Vallex, EngVallex and external resources, such as FrameNet, VerbNet, WordNet, etc. The resource is available for download and online browsing through LINDAT.

Name: STO syntax (v2) - LMF format
Description: This syntactic lexicon is available for download from the CLARIN-DK repository.

Name: A machine-readable dictionary of Egyptian Arabic
Description: This lexicon presents a more comprehensive version of A machine-readable glossary of Egyptian Arabic. The resource is available for download from ARCHE.

Name: Extended dictionary of named entities NELexicon connected with Linked Open Data
Description: This lexicon contains Polish named entities connected with terminology from available resources within Linked Open Data (e.g. WordNet, DBPedia, Wikipedia, etc.). The resource is available for download from the CLARIN-PL repository.

Name: MULTEXT-East non-commercial lexicons 4.0
Description: These are morphological lexica available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Inflectional lexicon srLex 1.3
Description: This is a large inflectional lexicon where each entry consists of a (wordform, lemma, MSD, MSD features, UPOS, morphological features, frequency, per-million frequency) 8-tuple. The (wordform, lemma, MSD) triple frequencies are calculated on the hrWaC v2.2 corpus. The MSD tagset follows the MULTEXT-East V6 tagset for the Serbo-Croatian macro-language. The UPOS and morphological features follow the UD v2 specifications. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI

Name: Maltese Speech Engine Lexicon
Description: This is a speech lexicon that is useful for building speech-to-text systems. It is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: Emotional Annotations Dictionary
Description: This is a lexicon with emotional annotation extracted from Polish Wordnet. The resource is available for download from the CLARIN-PL repository.

Name: EMOTAIX.PT
Description:
This is a lexicon of emotionally charged words in European Portuguese.
The lexicon is available from PORTULAN.

Name: DVPM-SynSem
Description:
This is a lexical database focussing on the syntax and semantics of verbs in medieval Portuguese.
The lexicon is available from PORTULAN.

Name: CroaTPAS
Description: This is a manually created verb sense lexicon.

Name: ILSP PsychoLinguistic Resource
Description: This is a lexicon for psycholinguistic research. The resource is available for download from clarin:el.

Name: Lexicon of discourse markers for European Portuguese
Description:
This lexicon contains pairs of discourse marker.
The lexicon covers conjunctions, prepositions, adverbs, adverbial phrases and alternative lexicalizations with a connective function.
For each discourse marker in the lexicon, there is information regarding its type, category, mood and tense restrictions over the sentence it introduces, rhetorical sense, as well as a link to an English near-synonym and a corpus example.
The lexicon is available from PORTULAN.

Name: The LiLaH Emotion Lexicon of Croatian, Dutch and Slovene
Description: This lexicon contains manual translations of the NRC Emotion Lexicon, which encodes the sentiment of a word (positive, negative) and its emotion association (anger, anticipation, disgust, fear, joy, sadness, surprise, trust) for Croatian, Dutch and Slovene with a binary schema. Manual translations were produced by inspecting and correcting the automatic translations from English provided with the original lexicon. While translations to all 14,182 entries are provided for Slovene and Croatian, only translations for the 6,468 entries that have any sentiment or emotion associated with the word are given for Dutch. The resource is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Parole+ (2017-10-16)
Description: This is a lexicon for language technologies which offers access to syntactic information and is connected to SALDO senses. The resource can be download from the SWE-CLARIN repository and can be queried online through KARP.

Name: Slovene sentiment lexicon KSS 1.1
Description: This is a lexicon of sentiment labels available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: STO morphology (v2) - LMF format
Description: This morphological lexicon is available for download from the CLARIN-DK repository. It is also available in the .csvformat.

Name: Reference Lexicon for Belgian-Dutch (RBBN)
Description: This lexicon, which contains words and expressions typically of Dutch spoken in Belgium, is available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: Automatically constructed multiword lexicon hrMWELex v0.5
Description: This is a lexicon of multiword expressions available for download from CLARIN.SI.

Name: MorfFlex CZ
Description: This is a morphological lexicon available for download from LINDAT.

Name: Walenty (2018-06-29)
Description: This is a lexicon of verb valency that is available for download from the CLARIN-PL repository.

Name: CombiLex
Description: This is a lexicon of words and word forms available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: The Database of Estonian Multi-Word Expressions
Description: This is a collection of lexica that contain multi-word expressions consisting of a verb and a particle or a verb and its complements. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: NomLex-BR
Description:
This lexicon provides mappings between verbs and their nominalisations for Brazilian Portuguese.
The lexicon is available from PORTULAN.

Name: Database of the Western South Slavic Verb HyperVerb -- Derivation
Description:
This lexicon contains 3000 most frequent Slovenian and 5300 most frequent BCS verbs which are all coded for a number of properties related to verb derivation.
The database is a table where each verb is given a row of its own. The coded properties are organized in columns. Verbs in the database are coded for the following properties: root information, whether or not the verb has prefixes and the identity of the included prefix(es), whether or not the verb has suffixes and the identity of the included suffix(es) etc. All coded properties are explained in the accompanying pdf file.
This resource is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.
Annotation: root, prefix and suffix information for verb forms

Name: CzEngVallex
Description: This is a valency lexicon linked to the parallel PCEDT corpus. The resource is available for download and online browsing through LINDAT.

Name: PDT-Vallex
Description: This is a valency lexicon linked to several Czech corpora (PDT, PCEDT Cz side, PDTSC, Faust). The resource is available for download and online browsing through LINDAT.

Name: EngVallex
Description: This is a valency lexicon linked to the English side of the PCEDT corpus (WSJ corpus). The resource is available for download from LINDAT and for online browsing.

Name: Porlex
Description: This is a lexicon that provides psycholinguistic and cognitive information that is useful to select stimulus materials for experiments and/or training vocabularies. The resource is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.
Annotation: orthographic and phonological/phonetic transcriptions, phonetic, MSD-tags, and frequency information

Name: OMBI Dutch-Indonesian
Description: This is a bilingual lexicon for language technology applications such as automatic translation, e-learning, multilingual information retrieval, etc. The resource is available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: PREMOVE – A diachronic dataset of Ancient Greek and Latin annotated PREverbed MOtion VErbs
Description: This lexicon provides open-access, corpus-based annotations of preverbed motion verbs in Ancient Greek and Latin (8th century BCE – 2nd century CE). The lexicon follows the Guidelines for a linguistic annotation of preverbed verbs of motion.
